info.title: Octez DAL Node RPC
info.description: The RPC API for the Octez DAL node.

post.description: Add a slot in the node's context if not already present. The corresponding commitment is returned.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

patch.description: Associate a commitment to a level and a slot index.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Return the known headers for the slot whose commitment is given.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Compute the proof associated with a commitment.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

put.description: Compute and save the shards of the slot associated to the given commitment. If the input's flag is true, the shard proofs are also computed.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Retrieve the content of the slot associated with the given commitment.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Return the known headers for the given published level.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Return the accepted commitment associated to the given slot index and published at the given level.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: A span of time in seconds

schema.description: Identifier for a peer point
The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Get the backoffs of the peers with a backoff, per topic.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Get this node's currently active connections.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Get the number of message ids in the message cache, grouped by heartbeat tick and topic.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Get the scores of the peers with a known score.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Get the topics this node is currently subscribed to.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Get an association list between each topic subscribed to by the connected peers and the remote peers subscribed to that topic. If the 'subscribed' flag is given, then restrict the output to the topics this node is subscribed to.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Get info of the requested peer

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

patch.description: Change the permissions of a given peer. With `{acl: ban}`: blacklist the given peer and remove it from the whitelist if present. With `{acl: open}`: removes the peer from the blacklist and whitelist. With `{acl: trust}`: trust the given peer permanently and remove it from the blacklist if present. The peer cannot be blocked (but its host IP still can). In all cases, the updated information for the peer is returned. If input is omitted, this is equivalent to using the `GET` version of this RPC.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`
The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Get list of known peers and their corresponding info.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: By default, get the list of known peers. When the 'connected' flag is given, then only get the connected peers.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: By default, get the list of known points. When the 'connected' flag is given, only get the connected points.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Get info of the requested point

The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: By default, get the list of known points and their corresponding info. When the 'connected' flag is given, then only get the connected points.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

post.description: Compute the proof associated with a page of a given slot.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Return the list of current profiles tracked by the DAL node.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

patch.description: Update the list of profiles tracked by the DAL node. Note that it does not take the bootstrap profile as it is incompatible with other profiles.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Return the shard indexes assigned to the given public key hash at the given level.

parameters.name: pkh
parameters.description: A Secp256k1 of a Ed25519 public key hash (Base58Check-encoded)

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Return the currently attestable slots at the given attested level by the given public key hash. A slot is attestable at level [l] if it is published at level [l - attestation_lag] and *all* the shards assigned at level [l] to the given public key hash are available in the DAL node's store.

parameters.name: pkh
parameters.description: A Secp256k1 of a Ed25519 public key hash (Base58Check-encoded)

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Fetch shard as bytes

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

post.description: Post a slot to the DAL node, computes its commitment and commitment proof, then computes the correspoding shards with their proof. The result of this RPC can be directly used to publish a slot header.

schema.title: Universal string representation
schema.description: Either a plain UTF8 string, or a sequence of bytes for strings that contain invalid byte sequences.
The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Fetch slot as list of pages

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: version

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

Signature.Public_key_hash.title: A Ed25519, Secp256k1, P256, or BLS public key hash (Base58Check-encoded)

distributed_db_version.description: A version number for the distributed DB protocol

distributed_db_version.name.description: A name for the distributed DB protocol

p2p_connection.id.description: The identifier for a p2p connection. It includes an address and a port number.

p2p_peer.state.description: The state a peer connection can be in: accepted (when the connection is being established), running (when the connection is already established), disconnected (otherwise).

p2p_point.info.description: Information about a peer point. Includes flags, state, and records about past events.

p2p_point.state.description: The state a connection to a peer point can be in: requested (connection open from here), accepted (handshake), running (connection already established), disconnected (no connection).

p2p_version.description: A version number for the p2p layer.

timestamp.system.description: A timestamp as seen by the underlying, local computer: subsecond-level precision, epoch or rfc3339 based.

unistring.title: Universal string representation
unistring.description: Either a plain UTF8 string, or a sequence of bytes for strings that contain invalid byte sequences.
